paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Median age 78 years, 82% ≥70 years, 16% female, 99% Caucasian

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The eldest ATTRv patient diagnosed was a 93-year-old Caucasian female with the Val142Ile variant.

functional_data.summary: The Val142Ile variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as indicated by genetic testing in relatives.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of genetic testing in elderly patients with ATTR-CM.
key_quotes: Diagnosis of ATTRv in elderly ATTR‐CM patients allowed initiation of transthyretin‐specific drug treatment in 5 individuals.

patients.demographics: Median age 78 years, 82% ≥70 years, 16% female, 99% Caucasian

functional_data.summary: The Val50Met variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as indicated by genetic testing in relatives.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of genetic testing in elderly patients with ATTR-CM.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data is based on the information provided in the main text.
